name: Algorithmic Trading
description: Our mission is simple: we want to teach our members about the world of trading, whether that be quantitative, algorithmic or the basics of financial markets. No matter if you are a first-year fresher, a final-year student or a post-grad, we host a variety of events and programmes to help you develop an interest in the area of markets and trading! We run events every week during term time, whether that may be our annual London inter-uni hackathon "Algothon", here on campus or a speaker from one of our sponsor firms! If you don't know the first thing about markets, you're in the right place! We run an 8-week AlgoCourse to train you on all the basics you need for a career in markets, done by fellow Imperial markets interns. To apply your understanding and get real-life experience, join us at our student-managed fund, Queen's Tower Capital, where you can give it your best shot at creating trading strategies! We have a new society this year: Imperial College Women in Trading society, introducing STEM-focused women to the fast-moving world of markets by bridging the gap between hard-science classrooms and live trading floors. Find more on our website and follow us on social media: We look forward to meeting you on-campus! Feel free to contact us: algo.trade@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Algorithmic Trading may have events with broader interest in finance and technology.
suggestedApproach: Promote their inter-university hackathon and introductory trading workshops across universities.

name: Alternative Music
description: What is alternative music? Anything. The weird and obscure, the danceable, the frankly unlistenable, Dutch glitch-core hip-hop, Japanese post-hardcore math-rock or occasionally indiepop, all musical genres are welcome here. This society is a group for music lovers, those who want to discover interesting and new music, and meet other people who are also fanatically obsessed with discovering new bands. Our members possess a huge wealth of knowledge about the London music scene, the latest upcoming bands and the venues to see them, and the side street record stores nobody knows about. Along with our weekly meets in the union, the society also hosts subsidised events for members throughout the year. In the past few years, some of the bands we’ve seen include: Tame Impala, Bon Iver, Alvvays, Michael Kiwanuka, Franz Ferdinand, Four Tet, James Blake, Wild Beasts, Mac DeMarco, Bloc Party, The Vaccines, SOPHIE, Animal Collective, Foals, Flume, Fat White Family, and many many more. We meet weekly to share new music, run record store pub crawls, host a radio show on ICRadio, and regularly produce content for the Felix Music section. See our social media pages or drop us an email if you want to get involved! CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Alternative Music society focuses on diverse musical experiences, potentially appealing to a wider audience.
suggestedApproach: Offer LSN to increase attendance at their events focused on discovering new music.

name: Artsoc
description: ArtSoc aims to encourage the Arts within Imperial College by finding the best student and group discount rates to the best performances in the world-famous West End. We also organise socials and day trips to festivals :) You'll make back your £5 membership fee and more by going to just one musical through us! Here at ArtSoc, we aim to let you enjoy West End productions without your finances going south. We hope to hold our annual ArtSoc International Tour in Spring which promises to be affordable for students on a tight budget without missing out on all the best attractions that the cities have to offer. Plays, musicals, comedy performances, concerts and other cultural events - Join our society to enjoy the spectacular arts scene in London with like-minded individuals! name: Big Band
description: IC Big Band, made up of scientists, engineers, and medics at Imperial, all with a passion for jazz, is a driving force in the university big band scene within London and the UK. The first-call band for events both in and out of the College, IC Big Band has garnered an exceptional reputation over the years, including national recognition on winning the platinum award at the National Concert Band Festival in 2017. We are a fully auditioned big band, with openings for saxophones, trumpets, trombones, rhythm, and vocalists. With an ever-expanding library with hundreds of charts, the band regularly perform sets ranging from the swing hits of Basie to the funk and fusion of Pat Metheny, and of course the classics of Miller-Ellington! We are directed by Chris Dean (leader of Syd Lawrence Orchestra), a giant in the UK big band scene, and have enjoyed plentiful gig opportunities under his direction, such as our sold-out annual gig at PizzaExpress Jazz Club (Soho) and our collaboration concert with the Syd Lawrence Orchestra in Spring 2022! As well as our outings at well-known venues in and around the capital, we also form an integral part of the Union entertainment calendar, with hugely popular termly gigs at Metric, appearances at Arts’ Nights, and our annual performances at the Summer Ball! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

name: Catholic
description: Welcome to the Imperial Catholic Society page! We are a friendly group of Catholic Christians who meet regularly on Wednesdays for two of the greatest things in the entire universe: Mass, and free lunch. We also get together on the 2nd Saturday of the month for a Vigil Mass and some time together affectionately referred to as 'MOPS' - Mass, fOod, Prayer and Social. Wherever you find yourself in relation to this man from Galilee called Jesus, we would love you to join us! Who is He? Why be Catholic and not just Christian? Our faith is a wonderfully rich treasure of wisdom and joy and practical action. We know that Jesus and His Church have been changing the world since 33AD and we can't wait for all that He has in store for us in London this coming year. Come and join us! name: Computational Biology
description: Computational Biology is a student-led society for those interested in the intersection between biology and computer science. It is one of the first of its kind in the UK for an industry that is set to grow to billions of dollars. This society is for life and computer scientists alike to gain knowledge, that might be currently missing in their undergraduate studies, that they'll need to start a career in CompBio. name: Dodgeball
description: You may have seen the film, or played it in PE, but Dodgeball is one of the country’s fastest-growing sports, and Imperial Dodgeball, ICL's Club of the Year 2023, is at the eye of the storm. After 16 years of growth, we’ve learned Dodgeball is simple, addictive, competitive, and most importantly, fun. We hold weekly training sessions in Ethos on Tuesday and Friday, and have been recognised for our work on inclusion, especially with newcomers and women. Here you can prepare for British Dodgeball matches, or just blow off some steam and chuck balls at people for a few hours. We have 3 Men’s Teams and 2 Women’s Teams in BUCS leagues, where last season both our Men’s and Women’s 1st Teams reached the National Championship Final's Day and our Women's 1s became National Champions. When not Dodging, Ducking, Dipping, Diving, or Dodging, we’re enjoying our socials. You can find us at the Union or tearing up the city with pub crawls, trampolining, and film nights (including a certain Underdog Story). And if that’s not enough, join us on our annual European Tour, with past locations like Copenhagen, Naples, and Porto. For more information, find us at the Welcome Fair or on Instagram @imperialdodgeball – come drop in on a session, we’re looking forward to meeting you! name: Energy
description: We are a student group open to anyone interested in the energy sector. The society aims to provide its members with the insight, skills and network to develop successful careers in energy-related industries. Members will be able to take part in various events throughout the year - Great opportunity to work on a real-life project, which is run in partnership with energy companies. Themes for this year include geothermal, nuclear fusion, and storage technology. Talks and networking events are hosted with speakers from diverse backgrounds to enable holistic industry understanding. We organise recruitment events, workshops and an annual Energy Careers Fair. name: Engineers Without Borders UK
description: We are Engineers Without Borders UK - a global collective of people that want to radically change the way we view and practice engineering. Traditionally, advancements in our fields have often been for the primary purpose of profit. The world of the future cannot be built with this as our central motive. What we need is highly-skilled, innovative and ethical engineers who put global responsibility as their core value. This is where EWB comes in. Using our ethos: “Inspire, Upskill, Drive Change”, we want to provide Imperial students with the hands-on training they need to solve the social and environmental issues of the future. Along with hundreds of university chapters worldwide, you’ll be part of the movement that will usher in a new wave of sustainability achievement. Deliver enriching and interactive events, socials and workshops that build the skills critical to the EWB 2030 strategy Deliver enriching and interactive events, socials and workshops that build the skills critical to the EWB 2030 strategy CSP Chair / President

name: Felix
description: In our pages, you will find news, investigations, opinion, and reviews on a wide variety of different topics, ranging from the environment and science, to music and the arts. Felix was first published on 9th December 1949. Since then, the paper has gone on to win national awards and break stories that have ended up in the national news. Our contributors – all former Imperial students – have achieved acclaim working for publications such as the BBC and the Financial Times. If print isn’t your preferred format, follow us on Instagram (@felix_imperial) or sign up for our weekly newsletter (see above), where we’ll send you an early digital copy of the newspaper, and give you bite-sized updates on the most important developments on campus. We aim to shed light on stories the College won’t tell you about, and to report on your experiences as students (and staff!). If you're interested in contributing, get in touch. We're also looking for many non-writer roles, including copyeditors, illustrators and photographers. Drop us an email to learn more! name: FemTech
description: The only FemTech society in London Femtech is a rapidly booming industry that focuses on the research and development of products, technology & services to improve women’s health. Throughout history, women have always been excluded from medical trials and long-term studies due to factors such as menstruation and pregnancy. This has led to a huge gender health gap, which still persists today, whereby women are often misdiagnosed and mistreated due to the lack of understanding of the difference in symptoms between men and women. However, this is all changing. The industry has grown immensely in the past few years – more money, effort, and attention are dedicated to tackling unmet needs in female healthcare, from collecting new health data, conducting research studies, developing new forms of treatment and assistive technology, and more. As a society, we hope to: - ⁠Shine light on inspiring individuals and organisations who are changing the course of female healthcare research; - Supply a platform for learning and networking opportunities within this field - Expand this awareness and vision to a wider and more diverse community. Throughout the year, we host frequent events ranging from educational lecture series, panel talks from professional speakers, networking opportunities, startup fairs, social events, as well as our annual collaboration with the FemTechnology Summit and our most-anticipated FemTech Conference. Make sure to become a member today! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: FemTech society focuses on women's health, which is a growing industry, and could attract other medical and tech students.
suggestedApproach: Offer to co-host events with FemTech societies at other London universities to expand their reach.

name: First Aid
description: At Imperial College First Aid Society (ICFAS), we’ll make sure you never have to wonder again! Every week, we run interactive first aid sessions that teach you the vital skills to stay calm, confident, and capable when it matters most. You’ll learn how to save lives, handle emergencies, and make a real difference! Want to take it even further? Through ICFAS, you can put your skills into action by becoming a volunteer First Aider with St John Ambulance, where the possibilities are endless. You will yourself at some of the UK’s biggest, most exciting and bizarre events, from tennis at Wimbledon, football, cricket, and rugby matches to the Lord Mayor’s Show, Notting Hill Carnival, and even world record attempts! Whatever tickles your fancy, there’s an event waiting for you. Along the way, you’ll discover just how far first aid can take you. Whether it’s treating patients, training new first aiders or cadets, getting involved in logistics or fundraising, or even driving an ambulance, there are countless ways to get involved! Join ICFAS today to meet amazing people, develop life-saving skills, boost your CV, and open the door to unforgettable experiences where you can make a difference and have fun doing it! 💚 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

During third term, we produce our 24-hour Opera - a musical planned in secret and revealed to the cast the day before the performance, so the whole show is prepped in 24 hours! Recent productions include 'Mamma Mia', ‘The Rocky Horror Picture Show’, and ‘Kinky Boots’, with all proceeds going to charity. Light Opera is one of the most active societies within ICSM, organising at least two socials per week in first term. The Light Opera family ranges from complete novices to those who were doing jazz hands in utero, with members spanning all years of ICSM, as well as many non-medic members! name: Music (ICSM)
description: ICSM Music Society encompasses a wide range of ensembles that socialise and rehearse weekly, offering something for musicians of all abilities and personality types! We consist of 5 ensembles: ICSM Orchestra, Choir, Chamber Choir, Jazz Band, and Bands. Each ensemble showcases top notch performances at various locations throughout the year, including local churches, pubs, clubs, and ICSM events. Our current members describe Music Society as "the best thing ever, even better than sliced bread". Musicians of all standards are welcome, medics and non-medics, and with the exception of Chamber Choir, there is no need to audition. We also have our own ICSM Music Scholarship for one Fresher to have free music lessons, and within the first few weeks of term, everyone has the opportunity to sing in the Royal Albert Hall! Our calendar is just PACKED with performances, socials, dinners and tours - come along, and you'll see why we are one of the largest and most active societies that ICSM has to offer. description: Last year's concerts included performances of Kallinikov's Symphony No. 1, Dvorak's Symphony No. 8, and Sibelius' Violin Concerto. We rehearse every Monday at 18.30, followed by a trip to hbar or union - the perfect way to start your week. We have a highly deserved reputation as being a very sociable orchestra, with socials organised throughout the year, and our weekend away in first term is a great ice-breaker for new players! Our fun-loving nature does not detract from our playing, however, and we put on fantastic performances three times a year, with some distinguished young soloists from Imperial. We are also one of the most travelled musical societies, touring yearly to locations such as Valencia, Croatia, Romania, as well as joint tours with ICSO to Prague and most recently Zaragoza and Burgos. We are always on the lookout for new players - no audition is required for strings or percussion, and we have occasional vacancies in woodwind, horns and brass. So if you'd like to be part of one of the most enjoyable and rewarding societies at Imperial, come and find us at Freshers' Fair! name: Punjabi
description: Our aim is to provide a space for people of all backgrounds to come together and enjoy the many aspects of Punjabi culture. Whether it’s the food, or the dance, or anything in between, we are proud of our heritage and want to share it with you. The events held range from Gupshup, a welcome dinner during freshers to give you a taste of our home, to Movie Nights to give you that true Punjabi feel (there are subtitles, don’t worry), to Bhangra classes, where you can learn to dance to the epic beat of a dhol drum. We also organise, present, and compete in the largest student show in the country: The Bhangra Showdown, where dancers from university teams all over the UK compete against one another to be crowned champions on stage in front of thousands of fans. Above all, we want to build a community, not of Punjabi people, but of people who appreciate everything Punjab has to give; and if you feel you don’t belong because you’re not Punjabi enough, take it from us, you are! name: Robotics
description: Imperial College Robotics Society (ICRS) ICRS is Imperial’s home for robotics, making, and creative engineering. Make – Use our hackspace to build whatever you can imagine. ICRS members can get unlimited free 3D printing with a Lab Pass! Learn – Take part in workshops and courses, including our popular Robotics 101! Hackathons – Create a team and build an incredible project over a weekend at one of our hackathons. Connect – Meet like-minded makers at talks, socials, and around in the lab! New to Imperial? name: Soup Run
description: One hundred homeless people benefit from our help every week. In addition to distributing food and hot beverages to those in need, we also have friendly, non-judgemental conversations with them when we talk about anything and everything. In some cases you may be the first person they've talked to for a whole day! Soup Run is much more than just giving out material things - we meet and interact with a variety of people in need that range from rough sleepers to people who have lost their job or are victims of broken home. We believe it is a valuable experience through which you will gain many life-skills while also having the opportunity to meet genuine people from Imperial with the same values who enjoy volunteering in a relaxed, friendly and fun environment, and knowing you have made a real difference in many people's lives. We are part of the London Soup Run Forum and give hot meals out on Sundays in Lincoln's Inn Fields (near Holborn). Joining our society is free and no commitment is required - feel free to attend when you have the time for a worthwhile break and want to join us for a good cause! CSP Chair / President

Events (generally, all members can join a team because we make more if one fills up): Central London Chess Congress – FIDE-rated tournaments that we host twice a year (usually during November and April) with around 100 participants (discounted entry fee for all club members). We can’t wait to meet you and make this year truly unforgettable. Here's a wonderful Jain principle: Parasparopagraho Jīvānām - "Live and Let Live"! See you soon at one of our events! name: Radiology Society
description: We'll be hosting a range of events, including tutorials relevant to common radiological presentations delivered by experienced consultants and registrars, careers talks, interactive demos and networking sessions, as well as interest talks in hot-button issues in the field such as promoting gender equality and whether interventional radiology should be its own specialty. Come along and get to know our team and other aspiring radiologists! CSP Chair / President

name: RCS Motor Club
description: If you're inclined to get up to your elbows in oil then you're more than welcome to help with repairs - you don't need to be mechanically minded, experienced or even skilled to help, simply turn up at the garage and we'll show you the ropes! Whether it's joyriding and exploring, greasing and oiling, camping and traveling or just generally making merry out and about in London, drop us an email or follow the sound of Jez's bell - I promise you won't regret it! CSP Chair / President

name: Riding & Polo
description: On top of weekly training, we host several events throughout the year popular with all our members, including Christmas Pony Games, trips to equestrian events like Olympia Horse Show, Badminton Horse Trials, Royal Ascot, and plenty of dinner and bar socials too! We are also already planning another Easter weekend tour riding on the beaches of Portugal. Come and visit us at Freshers' Fair, or ask us questions via email or social media! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Riding & Polo events have some spectator appeal.

name: Sailing
description: Last year the Imperial team competed at BUSA, getting two teams into Finals, as well as attending competitions in the London area and at Oxford, Cambridge, Reading and other universities. We sail at the renowned Queen Mary Reservoir, known for its high level sailing, offering us the opportunity to train alongside other experienced alumni teams! All members have access to club boats so you can sail whenever you want, should you want to escape the busy London life once a while. Furthermore, we host Summer Sail Week, our annual trip where we rent yachts and sail around either Greece or Croatia for a week. This year we will be visiting the Saronic Gulf, between the 7th and 14th of September. Tickets sell out extremely fast so keep your ears peeled for more information regarding the trip! If experience is anything to go by, it is not a trip to be missed. So, if you want to learn or improve, compete at universities over the country, be part of a team, escape central London and make lots of new friends then this is the club for you. Contact us on sailing@ic.ac.uk or message us on Instagram or href="https://www.facebook.com/imperialcollegesailing/">Facebook to find out more! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Sailing has inter-university competitions but may be a niche interest.
suggestedApproach: Suggest promoting their sailing competitions to other universities with sailing clubs.

name: SCUBA (Underwater) Club
description: We are a BSAC (British Sub-Aqua Club) branch, so we can teach you BSAC’s internationally recognised diver qualifications. All our instructors are (qualified!) volunteers and we own mountains of kit for hire (and three beautiful boats), so our courses are a fraction the cost of training elsewhere! We offer training to all skills levels, from beginner right through to technical training. We also welcome divers with non-BSAC qualifications to cross over and continue to learn with us! In addition to all this, we encourage extracurricular courses such as learning how to drive our club boats, Wreck Appreciation qualifications and Seasearch courses for UK Marine life surveying! With trips running most weekends through summer to a variety of UK dive hot spots (Portland, Farne Islands, Plymouth...), a week long training trip to Cornwall in Easter and annual summer tours (previously Costa Brava, Croatia, Lanzarote, and this year Malta!) you will definitely get your underwater fix with us! Our club calendar lists all of our upcoming trips, courses and socials. We meet at the bar in Beit Quad on Tuesdays around 7pm so come say hi! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: SCUBA Club may welcome other diving clubs in London to participate in activities.
suggestedApproach: Advertise courses and qualification offers to beginner divers at other London universities.

name: Squash (ICSM)
description: As the only medical school in London with its own squash club, we take pride in our rich tradition and vibrant community. We practice multiple times a week at Ethos Sports Centre and Charing Cross Sports Centre, conveniently located near the Charing Cross campus. Our sessions are tailored to fit the demanding schedules of medical students, ensuring you can balance both your academic and athletic pursuits. Whether you’re a complete beginner or a seasoned pro, we have specialized training sessions and drills to match your ability. For those with a competitive edge, we field two Men’s teams and a Women’s team in the LUSL leagues, competing on Monday evenings. But squash at ICSM is more than just a sport—it’s a social hub. From curry nights to themed pub crawls, our lively social events foster a friendly and inclusive atmosphere. This year, you can expect to find us in every Sports night at Reynolds, so come say hi! While we are proud to be a medics’ squash club, we warmly welcome non-medics as well. Our members come from all standards and across the entire university. To make squash accessible to everyone, we provide the appropriate shoes and rackets for our members. You are also welcomed to bring your own equipment! Join us not just for the game, but for the camaraderie and support. At ICSM Squash, you’ll find a family that helps you excel both on the court and in your studies.
relevanceReasoning: Squash (ICSM) is likely focused on medical students, reducing its cross-university appeal, though open events could increase interest.
suggestedApproach: Highlight any beginner sessions or open tournaments to attract students from other universities.

name: Students for Global Health
description: We work with national and international teams to create policies about the topics we are passionate about, whether it be mental health, access to medicines or climate change. There are opportunities to work with government departments, attend international conferences and attend the World Health Assembly. Working closely with allied organisations, we work to raise awareness and create change in the topics we are passionate about. This can include anything from petitions to fundraisers to direct actions in front of Parliament! We run educational events to teach people what global health is and more about current affairs within the field. We also work to transform the medical curriculum to include global health to a greater extent. It is all well and good wanting to change the world but you need to know how! Here at Students for Global Health Imperial we want to build your capacity in key skills you will need to make true change. Through local and national courses, we provide you with the practical skills to do just that. There are plenty of opportunities to meet academics or other like-minded students and carry out research that interests you. Some projects in the past have included a global health university league table and a national student survey on exposure to pharmaceutical marketing. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer
tagline: Welcome to Students for Global Health
relevanceReasoning: Students for Global Health's activities, like policy work, can be of interest to a wider audience, but it's still primarily ICSM focused.
suggestedApproach: Advertise any public campaigns or workshops related to global health issues to engage students outside of ICSM.

name: TeddyBear Hospital
description: In TeddyBear Hospital we aim to teach children about what it means to be a healthcare professional and what happens in hospitals, in hopes of helping them overcome White Coat Anxiety and inspire them to learn more about Medicine. Every Wednesday we visit a different primary school and teach children about simple topics in Medicine. For example, how to call 999; what exactly a ‘surgery’ is; why washing your hands is important or what is the purpose of a skeleton! At the same time, we provide our volunteers with an opportunity to help the community, practice skills in paediatrics by interacting with children and even improve their teaching skills. We are a very low-commitment group – so you can join us as often or as rarely as you want! So, if you are passionate about teaching children about medicine, looking to do some low-commitment volunteering or simply curious about what we do, join us! If you have any questions, or want to find out more, please drop us a message on social media or by email. Facebook: ICSM Teddybear Hospital Instagram: @icsmteddybear Email: icsmutbh@ic.ac.uk Website: union.ic.ac.uk/medic/tbh/ CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
relevanceReasoning: TeddyBear Hospital engages with the wider community, though primarily serves as an outreach for ICSM.
suggestedApproach: Promote volunteer opportunities and highlight the impact of their work on local children.

name: Tennis (ICSM)
description: For competitive and intermediate players, we have 1st and 2nd teams, that both train twice a week on Wednesdays and Sundays and also receive coaching as well as playing in the LUSL mixed leagues against other universities. For beginners and less experienced players, we run more relaxed social tennis sessions every Sunday, with rackets and balls provided. There are also opportunities for social players to get coaching from our LTA-accredited team members throughout the term! ICSM Tennis is an incredibly social club – we are regular attendees of Wednesday sports nights at Reynolds and also run our own socials, which recently have included bowling, ping pong, bbqs and trips to Wimbledon. As well as socials, we love to go on tour – previous domestic destinations include Brighton and Bath, and last year we had an international tour to Tenerife, Spain! For more info, follow and dm our Instagram, @icsmtennis, or email us at medics.tennis@imperial.ac.uk! CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Tennis (ICSM) club is more tightly knit to medical school and might not bring engagement from other colleges.
suggestedApproach: Highlight any social or beginner sessions open to non-ICSM students to broaden the appeal.

name: Tennis (RSM)
description: The club holds weekly training sessions every Saturday at Ravenscourt Park. These sessions are ran by more experienced players and provide an environment that allows beginners to learn the basics and improve together. It doesn't matter if you have never held a tennis racket before, come along and give the sport a go! Both RSM students and students from the wider College community are welcome to join us. Sign up today by messaging our Instagram (@rsm_tennis) or dropping one of our committee members an email if you are looking for an casual tennis club with no pressure to play. We hope to see you soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

name: Weights & Fitness (ICSM)
description: ICSMSU Weights & Fitness Club is a must for anyone with a passion for exercise and fitness. Originally part of St Mary's Medical School, we run a large hi-spec gym at St Mary's Hospital, this year celebrating its 33rd birthday. The gym boasts the largest free-weights section in Imperial, making us perfect if you're serious about getting bigger. If you just want to get fit, our extensive cardio and resistance sections are perfect if you're in Wilson House or on attachment at St Mary's. Recently reopened after a period of closure due to COVID, we are open again and taking memberships! Do not hesitate to drop into the gym or email us for more information. Happy lifting!
